snippet: For all the men who return each year to the French Open with hope of defeating Rafael Nadal, Robin Soderling is proof that it can be done. But Nadal has yet to lose a set through the quarterfinals.
abstract: Christopher Clarey On Tennis column notes that Rafael Nadal has yet to lose a set through the men's quarterfinals at this year's French Open; holds that for all the men who return each year with hope of defeating Nadal at Roland Garros, only Robin Soderling is proof that it can be done, and he is too ill to play this year.
lead_paragraph: For all the men who return each year to the French Open with hope of defeating Rafael Nadal, Robin Soderling is proof that it can be done. But Nadal has yet to lose a set through the quarterfinals.

headline.seo: Beholding Nadal’s Empire of Clay at the French Open
